page.title: 02BROCKET HALL - PART 1
page.content: In 1746 the Brocket Estate was purchased by Matthew Lamb. A new brick mansion was built to the design of an architect called James Paine, and in 1781 the owner was created Viscount Melbourne, MP. One story is that he attended Parliament for forty years without ever making a speech! Lord and Lady Melbourne had six children, of whom the second son, William, born in 1779, was reputedly his mother's favourite and later inherited both the estate and the title of Lord Melbourne. His early education, it is said, began in the village school but later attended Eton and Cambridge University. In 1806 he was elected to the House of Commons becoming first Home Secretary and then in 1834 Prime Minister of the United Kingdom at the age of fifty-five.
